page.title: 05THE COTMANHAY B.M.X. PROJECT
page.content: {The B.M.X. track}was built in 1984 at a cost of Â£4000.{The Ilson Gunners} B.M.X. club race there. They hold meetings every three weeks. Members pay Â£l.50 to race. At every meeting the St. John's Ambulance Brigade are there in case of accidents. Before you start you take your bike to be checked. You have to wear a helmet and gloves. {Sometimes the Committee}holds a meeting. They ask you what faults are in the track and how to improve it. It is quite a good track, but if it rains it gets swampy. They have changed the track a lot since they built it. There is a new starting gate, they have added new jumps and a new turn. {At Christmas the Ilson Gunners}hold a party for all the club and team members.
